phrase: The search could not be completed because the search keywords were too short, too long, or too common.
Search for Gravatar when users do not have an avatar

The search text must be a full regular expression. The replace field must be in the form of className::methodName to call. The callback will receive one argument, an array of matches from the regular expression. It must return the updated template string.
The search text must contain the delimiters and modifiers to use in the regular expression.
Search threads started by this member only

Security error occurred. Please refresh the page and try again.

Select all items in this group.
Select / deselect all conversations on this page
Select / deselect all posts on this page
Select / deselect all threads on this page
Select the forum into which new discussions created from this feed will be posted.

ID of selected navigation tab, such as forums, members or help.
Selecting this option will permanently and irreversibly delete the item.
The server did not respond in time. Please try again.
A server error occurred. Please try again later.
Server errors have been logged. You should review these.

Setting a permission to 'Never' will prevent this permission from being overridden by values in other permission sets or in node permissions.
If you are not sure this is the behavior you want, select 'Not Set (No)' instead.

Setting a permission to 'Never' will prevent this permission from being overridden by values in other permission sets or in child nodes.
If you are not sure this is the behavior you want, select 'Revoke' instead.
Set return path with -f parameter (recommended, but does not work on all servers)
Should this conversation receive further responses in the future, this conversation will be restored to your inbox.
Show day and month of birth
Show only files attached to content of type...
Show people's signatures with their messages
Show this site on the list of 'supported' sites shown to visitors
Show this smilie in the text editor
The sitemap contents can be controlled via the XML Sitemap Generation options.
Include all pages in a forum
If you select this option, every single page with threads will be included in the sitemap. Else, only the main forum URL will be.
If you select this option, the URLs for the forums will be included in the sitemap
If you select this option, the URLs for the members' profile pages will be included in the sitemap
Include the pages created from the Nodes section
Include all pages in a thread
If you select this option, every single page with posts will be included in the sitemap. Else, only the main thread URL will be.
If you select this option, the URLs for the threads will be included in the sitemap
Smilie category IDs must be unique

Use this option to scan a web-accessible directory containing smilie images and then manually enter configuration data for each smilie to be imported. Ensure that the smilie images are uploaded before proceeding with this step.

Use this option to import an XML file containing smilie definitions. Before proceding to the next step, you should ensure that you have manually uploaded all necessary smilie images to your server in the appropriate locations.
Smilie replacement text must be unique. The replacement '{text}' is already in use.
Some data may not be rebuilt retroactively. Use this option only if you have a specific reason to do so. Data deletion can not be undone.
Some fields contained unexpected data. Please try again or contact the administrator.
Someone comments on a message on your profile page or your status
Someone comments on a message you left on someone else's profile
Someone comments on a profile post that you have commented on
Someone directly quotes one of your messages in a thread
Someone likes a message you left on a member profile page
Someone likes one of your messages in a thread
Someone posts a message on your profile page
Someone replies and attaches a file to a thread you are watching
Someone replies to a thread you are watching
Someone tags you in a message
Someone tags you in a post or comment on someone's profile
Something went wrong. Please try again or contact the administrator.
I'm sorry Dave, I'm afraid I can't do that.
Sorry, you must wait longer to create an account.
Sorry, you are too young to create an account.
The source database connection details are not correct: {error}
Spam. Please contact the administrator if this was done in error.
It is not possible to use the spam cleaner against administrators or moderators.
You may not use the spam cleaner against users who have been registered for longer than {register_days} days.
You may not use the spam cleaner against users who have received more than {total_likes} likes.
You may not use the spam cleaner against users with more than {message_count} messages.
The spam cleaner was run by {name}
Your registration has been rejected as it resembles automated or spam-like behavior. Please contact the administrator for further information or assistance.
The specified add-on does not match the add-on you chose to upgrade.
The specified add-on is already installed. Please use the upgrade page if you would like to upgrade it.
The specified add-on is older than the install version. Downgrading is not possible.
The specified destination node does not exist.
The IP address specified is invalid.
The specified member cannot be found. Please enter a member's entire name.
The specified URL cannot be embedded as media.
Spin box tags must specify a name.
Staff members cannot be banned from replying.
Staff members may not be ignored.
Sticky threads appear at the top of the first page of the list of threads in their parent forum
Check new registrations against the StopForumSpam database.

StopForumSpam will test the data collected from registering users and attempt to determine if they are a known spammer. Each warning flag that the user generates will be counted. Flags include user name, email and IP address.
You may choose to only count hits against the spam database that have previously been reported a certain number of times.
Only count flags recorded at least this many times
In order to avoid false positives, you may opt to only count hits against the spam database that have been previously recorded within a limited time period.
Only count flags recorded within the last X days
Moderate registrations when this many warning flags are detected
Specify the number of warning flags (1-3) that are required for a registration to be placed in the moderation queue rather than accepted automatically.
Reject registrations when this many warning flags are detected

Specify the number of warning flags (1-3) that are required for a registration to be automatically rejected. This number should be equal to or greater than the value for the moderation threshold above.
Submit spammer information to StopForumSpam using API key

If you have an API key from StopForumSpam, you may have spammer activity on your site automatically reported back to StopForumSpam in order to improve the database for other users. This option will cause users who are banned via the spam cleaner to be reported.
The specified string could not be converted to an input object, either because it was not found or because it contained errors.
This style contains no customized templates or style properties.
Style properties in this style can not be modified. Please try another.
This styles the element that appears when AJAX operations are in progress.
Controls the appearance of the pointer-arrow attached to alert balloons.
Controls the appearance of the balloons that appear above Inbox and Alerts in the navigation bar to indicate unread items.
If you enable animations, you can adjust the speed using the multiplier. 1: Normal speed, 0.5: double speed, 2: half speed etc.
Controls the display of most avatars (user identity pictures) shown throughout the system.
Styles the row in which the type of BB code is noted (HTML, Code etc.)
Controls the basic layout of a BB code block such as [quote] or [code].
Styles the area containing code such as [php], [html] and [code].
Controls the appearance of the attribution row that sits above a quoted message.
This will specify the maximum height of a quote block. Enter 0 to allow quotes to always expand to fit their content.
This styling applies to the message area of [QUOTE] blocks, styling the actual quoted message itself.
This definition is used together with the BB Code Block definition to provide styling for [QUOTE] blocks.
Controls the styling of the block of spoiler text when it is displayed.

This property controls the CSS for the main <body> element of XenForo pages.
Primarily, it is used for text styling, which is inherited by almost all other elements within XenForo.
Sometimes the top breadcrumb is associated with a call to action button. This property controls the container for that button.
Controls the container within which the breadcrumb sits.
You may optionally display the board title at the head of your breadcrumb.
Controls the styling of title prefixes when shown within breadcrumb elements.
This property controls the .button class, which is used for form controls and action buttons throughout the system.
Used to style the 'clicked' state of call to action buttons
Used to style the mouse-over / hover state of call to action buttons.
Controls the <span> inside call to action buttons
Controls the style of major call to action buttons such as 'Reply to Thread'.
Applied to level one (no parent) categories. The majority of the styles for category strips come by default from the @subHeading style property.

The styling of the main page area is controlled with this property.
Its primary function is to provide the content background color.
Styles longer explanatory text that may appear below form controls in control units.
Styles the area containing the actual form controls and any explanation text within the control unit.
Defines a horizontal spacing either side of control units.
Controls the display of any inline validation errors that appear with form element labels.
Styles any supplementary text to accompany the label for form controls in the labels area.
Defines the width of the label area to the left of form control units. Should add up to 100% with the value block width.
Controls the area containing the label within the control unit.
Defines the width of the main value block of form control units. Should add up to 100% with the label width
Form Control Unit Value Block Width
Controls the individual blocks around which forms in XenForo are built.
Style property definitions must be unique per style. The specified ID is already used in this style.
Controls the appearance of flags / icons for discussions such as sticky, locked etc.
Controls the width of the avatar cell.
Controls the appearance of the avatar of the user who started the discussion.
Controls the display of text on the first row of discussion list items, including the title.
Controls individual items within the discussion page nav.
Changes applied to page links on hover.
Item Page Nav Link, Hover State
Controls the width of the 'last message' cell.
Mini-Me is the small avatar of the current visitor that shows up on discussions in which the visitor has posted.
Mini-Me is the small avatar of the current visitor that shows up on discussions in which the visitor has posted.
Controls the appearance of the display options panel that can appear below the discussion list.
This option allows the multi-page navigator shown on discussion list items with multiple pages to remain hidden until the item is moused-over.
Hide item page navigator unless hovered
Controls the specific styling of prefixes to discussion titles when shown in the discussion list.
Controls the second row of text for discussion list items.
Controls the width of the statistics cell.
Alters the display of discussion list item titles when they contain unread messages.
Controls the width of external authentication buttons such as 'Log in with Facebook'.
The content of the rich text editor should appear in the same colors, fonts etc. as your messages. If it does not, you can use this style property to tweak the appearance.
You may disable all overlays and instead load full pages by switching off this option.
Choose a color scheme for all Facebook plugins in this style.
Styles the container of the style and language chooser trigger controls.
Styling to be added to links in the main footer section in their hover state.
Styling for links in the main footer section
Styles the block of links usually shown on the right of the footer.
Controls the appearance of the container for the upper footer section.
Defines the amount that controls should be indented from controls upon which they depend.
Form Control Unit Controls Indent Width
Styling for placeholder / prompt text in text controls.
Controls the appearance of buttons in form overlays.
Styles any supplementary text provided for control labels etc.
Controls minor headings within form-type overlays.
Controls hovered tabs on form overlays.
Control the panel that sits below a collection of tabs in a form overlay.
Controls the appearance of individual tabs within form overlays.
Controls the appearance of tabs within form overlays.
Controls disabled text controls in form overlays.
Controls text controls in form overlays when focused.
Controls the placeholder / prompt text within text controls in form overlays.
Alters the appearance of text controls within form-type overlays.
Controls textual headings within form-type overlays.
Controls the appearance of form-type overlays.
Controls the maximum width of forms using the .xenForm class.
Controls the appearance of the generic thumbnail shown for non-image attachments.
Controls the appearance of BB code elements within messages.
Controls the breadcrumb unit, which allows users to navigate back up to the site home page.
Contains properties used to style the various types of buttons used by XenForo.
The set of colors used to build this style.
Controls the appearance of the list of discussions within a forum or a conversation etc.
Controls the bottom of the page
Controls the appearance of form-type overlays and their contents.
Defines the layout and style of most forms in XenForo.
General style settings for this style.
Controls the appearance of the header and navigation elements of all pages.
Style properties for the profile information overlay.
Styles the blocks used for each member on the member list.
Style properties for pages showing detailed information about members.
Controls the layout of the full-size message template.
Controls the content area of the full message template.
Styling for the icons that denote different node types.
Controls the appearance of the list of forums, categories, pages etc.
Style properties for the notices system
Styling for overlays and tooltips that allow content to be displayed on-top of regular page content.
Controls multi-page links, link groups and tabs other than those in the header.
Styling for most popup menu elements can be found here.
Controls settings and options for the responsive elements of the style.
Controls the styling of the rich text editor box and toolbar.
Controls building-block classes used for the vast majority of the XenForo interface.
Controls the XenForo sidebar and various elements that appear within it.
Widget display settings for this style.
Style property groups must be unique per style. The specified ID is already used in this or a parent style.
Enter the height in pixels that you would like to reserve for the logo in the header.
This path describes the location of the main logo image used in the header of all pages.
This property controls the browser background and text.
This path represents either the relative or absolute path to images used by the XenForo user interface. You may change this to point to a CDN if you wish.
The values specified here will be applied to items selected for inline moderation.
Controls the amount of separation between items in link groups.
Individual links within link groups, as defined above.
Styles normal textual links when hovered.
The default styling for textual hyperlinks.
The height in pixels of the collapsed login bar.
Controls the layout and appearance of the form element within the login bar.
Controls the appearance of the handle by which the login bar is activated.
Textual hyperlinks within the login bar.
Extra properties for text controls when disabled.
Extra properties for text controls when focused.
Controls the appearance of text boxes in the login bar.
Additional properties to be applied to the login bar user name input box.
Controls the basic styling of the login bar.
Minimum width of the primary log in button.
The maximum width in pixels of the window where the medium responsive layout will be used. This will generally be used for phones in landscape orientation and 7" tablets in portrait orientation.
The maximum width in pixels of the window where the narrow responsive layout will be used. This will generally be used for phones in portrait orientation.

The maximum width in pixels of the window where the wide responsive layout will be used. This will generally be used for 7" or 8" tablets in landscape orientation, 10" tablets in portrait orientation, and narrow desktop windows.
This property applies to the user avatar shown in member list items.
Sometimes extra information will be shown inside a member list item. This applies styling to that content.
Width of fixed column in extended member list items.
On occasions, extra content is added to member list items. Use this to restyle it.
Applied in addition to the regular user name styling.
Controls the style of the container for everything in the member list item except the user avatar.
This property is applied to the contain for all user info underneath the main user name link.
User titles in member list items are styled with this property.
Applies to the main user name link on member list items.
Controls the appearance of the container for member list items.
The smaller text that sometimes appears below the main menu title.
The large text that appears at the top of pop-up menus.
The minimum height for pop-up menus.
Defines the minimum width for all pop-up menus.
The main container for the pop-up part of pop-up menus.
Styles the block that surrounds the large avatar for a message author.
This is used to enclose the message text and any other user-generated content for the message, such as attached files.
Controls the appearance of the (optional) extra user info that can be displayed under the message poster's avatar and user name.

This element contains the content area of the message template.
In the default style, it is used to enclose the right column of the message template, which contains the message text and controls.
This styles the block that displays the summary of users who have liked the message.
This is the container used for lists of messages.
Defines the appearance of message controls such as Edit, Delete, Like, Reply.
This block sits below the main content area and includes the inline moderation checkbox, permalink and message controls.
Notices are used to display information such as the message being in the moderation queue, or being deleted.
If enabled, this controls the appearance of the online status indicator on messages.
Container for controls generally seen only by privileged visitors - Edit, Delete, IP etc.
Container for controls seen by general visitors - Like, Reply etc.
Show any custom fields that are set to display in message user info. This setting is individually controlled by each custom field
Show the gender of the message poster, if specified.
Display a link to the home page of the message author, if they have entered one.
Show the message author's location, if they have provided one.
Display the total number of messages posted by the message author.
Show the message poster's occupation, if specified.
Display the date on which the message author signed up.
Display the total number of times content by the message author has been 'liked'.
Display the message poster's total accumulation of trophy points.

The text shown in the body of full-size messages will be controlled by the values set in this property.
It does not apply to small messages, such as profile posts and comments, which use the text styling from 'body'.
This unit directly encloses the avatar, user name and other user info for a message.

This container encloses the avatar, user name, user title and additional user info elements.
Its primary purpose in the default style is to provide the left column of the message template.
Styles the container for the author user name and user title next to messages.
Controls the appearance of the user title displayed with the message poster's user name.
Styling for the name of the person who posted the message.
This element entirely surrounds each message.
Controls each individual navigation tab link.
Styles links under the selected navigation tab, in their hover state.
Styles each link in the row of controls below the selected navigation tab.
Styles the currently-selected header navigation tab.
Controls the container for the header navigation tabs.
The triangle / arrow attached to node description tooltips
Controls the display of non-tooltip node description text.
Controls the appearance of the icon for forums with unread content.
Controls the appearance of the icon for forums with no unread content.
Controls the appearance of the icon for link-nodes.
Controls the appearance of the icon for pages.
Controls the large icon shown on forum, page and link nodes.
This controls the block of info describing the last post made within a forum (usually) node.
Show descriptions only when hovering over forum titles on the main node list. This applies only if "Show Forum Descriptions on Node List" is enabled.
Include descriptions underneath node titles on the main node list.
Show Forum Descriptions on Node List
If enabled, all sub-forums will be shown in a popup menu. If disabled, direct sub-forums will be displayed below the forum.
Controls the display of the total number of discussions, messages etc.
This controls the area within which the main text for node display is contained.
Changes to be made to tiny icons when the mouse moves over them
This controls the appearance of small icons such as the RSS feed icon.
Extra properties to apply to node titles when they contain unread content.
Controls the display of non-category node titles
If the responsive design is disabled globally or for a specific page, this will define the minimum width of the page.
Set the amount of time in milliseconds for which each notice is shown on screen before the next notice scrolls into view.
Enter a duration (in milliseconds) for the notice scroll animation. A value of zero will disable animation, and this value is subject to the XenForo global animation speed multiplier.
By default, notices will scroll from side-to-side.
This logo will be displayed in Facebook when a visitor likes a page on your site. Must be at least 200x200 and should be square.
Styles the 'close' gadget that is added when no other control is provided to close an overlay.
Speed in milliseconds for overlays to fade out. Default: 100.
Controls the maximum width of forms using the .xenForm class when being shown in an overlay.
Controls the degree of transparency of the mask applied to the background content when an overlay is shown. Default: 0.6; fully transparent: 0; fully opaque: 1.
This is the property that controls the main container for overlays, including their border and shadow etc.
Speed in milliseconds for overlays to fade in. Default: 200.
Default position of overlays relative to the top of the browser window.
Styles the optional description text that may be presented below the page title.
These rules are applied in addition to the normal page link rules in order to distinguish the current page.
Used to control each individual page navigation link including page numbers, next and previous buttons etc.

This element is used in instances where a page navigation block is placed alongside a group of links, such as above the list of threads on the forum view, or above the list of messages on thread view.
Controls the amount of space between individual page navigation links.
This width is the basis for all page navigation links.
Controls the appearance of page links when the mouse hovers over them.
Controls the appearance of the scroll buttons that appear when more than seven pages are available.
The container for the page navigation element, normally controls overall elements such as font size etc.
Modifications to the page width at the medium responsive width point.
Modifications to the page width at the narrow responsive width point.
Modifications to the page width at the wide responsive width point.

The width of the page is controlled with this property. Use this to switch between liquid and fixed layouts. To support responsive design, a fixed width value should not be used here; instead, a max-width value should be applied.
Controls the container of the navigation controls.
Styles each individual navigation control for the panel scroller.
Styling for individual panels in the notices system.
Styles the main outer container for notices / panel scrollers.
Points down, indicates the menu can be opened
Indicates that the menu can be closed
Controls the appearance of popup controls as the mouse passes over them when the menu is closed.
Styles the arrow attached to content preview tooltips that points to the content.
This defines the style of the element used for thread, and other content preview tooltips.
Styling for links within primaryContent containers.
Styles text that describes where the user was last active.
Styles the values for fields in sidebar info blocks.
Styles the labels for data in info blocks.
Controls the styling of the outer section of sidebar info blocks.
Specifies the width of the sidebar for the member profile page. This sidebar is usually the same width as the large avatar.
Controls the height of the tabs on the profile page.
Styles profile page tabs when hovered
Controls the amount of indent from the notional left margin to the tabs area.
Additional styling for the selected tab on the profile page.
Styles the tabs at the top of the profile page.
Styles the text of the current user status message, if shown.
Styles the large heading showing the name of the person whose profile page this is.
Styles the outer container for the profile page elements.
Styles the content of redirect messages shown after AJAX submissions.
Styles the container for redirect messages that appear after some forms are submitted with AJAX.
This represents the box that contains both the toolbar and the actual editor.
When the editor is not the main element on the page (such as with quick reply), enabling this will fade the editor and editor toolbar out until the user focuses it.
Allow the rich text editor to be faded out
This represents the toolbar that contains the text formatting options.
If enabled, all notices will be put into a single container that scrolls between them.
Styling for links within secondaryContent containers.
Footnotes or summary for a section
Controls the layout of the sidebar element.
This styling is applied to user status message tooltip arrows, in addition to the regular tooltip arrow styling.
This styling is applied to tooltips showing user status messages, in addition to the regular tooltip styling.
Occasionally, sub-headings may be used as block-level links. In these cases, this property controls what happens to the sub-heading link on hover.
Controls the appearance of the selected tab.
Controls general tabs in their hover state.
Controls the appearance of individual tabs in general tabbed interfaces.
Controls the appearance of tabbed user interfaces other than those in the navigation bar.
Additional styling to be applied to text controls if they are to contain code rather than regular text.
Additional styling to be applied to text controls in their disabled state.
Styling to be applied to text controls when they receive focus.
Additional styling to be applied to text controls when focused if they are multi-line textarea types.
Styling to be applied to <input type="text" /> and <textarea> text-editing elements.
Display text underneath the main page title.
Show forum descriptions on thread list
Controls the styling of title prefixes when your pointer hovers over them.
Controls the styling of prefixes attached to discussion titles throughout the system.
The extra arrow often shown with tooltips.
The basic styling for all generic XenForo tooltips.
Styling for links posted in messages.
Layout for the visitor panel on the sidebar.
The name of the logged-in visitor.
Enable this property to show links to child nodes for Widget Page navigation tab. Please note that no permission check will be perform.
Enable this property to copy links under "Forums" navigation tab to the one for Widget Page.
Enable this property to render a "Home" navigation tab for the selected Widget Page.

This property will be applied to all Threads widgets with full layout.
This property will be applied to all Threads widgets with full layout.

This property will be applied to all Threads widgets with full layout.

This property will be applied to all Threads widgets with full layout.

All Content you submit or upload may be reviewed by staff members. All Content you submit or upload may be sent to third-party verification services (including, but not limited to, spam prevention services). Do not submit any Content that you consider to be private or confidential.

We reserve the rights to remove or modify any Content submitted for any reason without explanation. Requests for Content to be removed or modified will be undertaken only at our discretion. We reserve the right to take action against any account with the Service at any time.

Export original templates and modifications. This keeps info about modifications but works only if TMS is installed.
If final template is not valid all it's modifications are ignored. Check Server Error Log.

You may optionally specify a PHP callback here in order to make complicated modifications.

Callback signature:
&$templateText, &$applyCount, $styleId
Callback arguments:
  1. string &$templateText
    The template text. Designed to be modified.
  2. integer &$applyCount
    The number of applied changes. Using it you can ensure that modification applied correctly.
  3. integer $styleId
    ID of the style for which template is being compiled.
Modification titles must be unique. The specified title is already in use.

This renderer supports caching for improved performance, you can enter the number of seconds for time to live (TTL) value to suit your need. Leave it blank to let the renderer decide the TTL itself. Enter 0 will effectively disable caching.

Select this option to make an exact copy of widgets from the XML file. All existing widgets will be deleted completely. This action can not be undone.

The position of this widget relative to other widgets in the same position. If the display order is negative, its contents will be inserted before the original contents of the position. Otherwise, it will be appended.

Enter your expression here. Please use the correct PHP syntax and make sure you know 100% which variables are available in target position. For template position, all template parameters will be accessible but for hook position, only hook parameters will be accessible. Some common used expressions:

$visitor['user_id'] > 0 -- means: show the widget for logged in users only.

XenForo_Template_Helper_Core::callHelper('ismemberof', array($visitor,3)) -- means: show the widget for users of user group #3 only.
Enter HTML code here. It will be displayed as is.
Invalid position specified: {position}. The position must be one of three types: "all", "template_name" or "hook:hook_name".

Please confirm that you want to delete the following widget
Please confirm that you want to delete the following widget page
Enter the thread ID of the thread you want to display. Leave it blank to get the latest poll, enter "random" to get a random one each time.
Widget position can not be empty.

There are three types of positions:
- The "all" position will make the widget show up in the sidebar of all pages.
- Or you can input a comma separated list of templates that need the widget. Popular templates: forum_list (the index page), forum_view (the individual forum page), thread_view (the thread page).
- Or you can input a comma separated list in the format of "hook:hook_name" to render the widget directly to the hook. For example: "hook:page_container_content_top" will make the widget visible at the top of the page, on every page.

You can browse the site with templates and hooks information here.
Feel free to contact me if you have question about this.
The provided file is not an widgets XML file.

Allow Multiple Statuses From Same User
Enable this option to list all statuses by their posting order. If a user posted many statuses continuously, all of them will be shown.
Enable this option to show an update form if the current user has permission to do so.

The "Special" selections are experimental, use with your own risk. Current forum is detected by the parameter "$forum" of the template, it should work as expected in thread_view or forum_view. The behavior is unexpected in other positions.

You can group several widgets together and have them rendered in a tabbed layout if more than one has content. Special format for advanced grouping:
- "random": only one widget of the group will be rendered at a time. You can also use "random1" or "random2" if you wish to have more than one random group in one position.
- "columns": the widgets will be rendered in column layout, divided equally between widgets. Use "columns1" or similar to have many columned group in one position.
